page.title: 14The Milk Race 1985
page.content: The{Milk Race}started at{Bournemouth and came round to{Hemlington.}The Hemlington stage started at the{Post {House.}Before the race started lots of policemen were coming round on their motorbikes. There were lots of{bike {riders}in cars with the bikes on top. The{leader}wears a{yellow jersey.} The{winner}of this stage was{Eric van {Lancker.}It was a very good race. They were racing for fifteen laps around Hemlington. The{Milk Race}is sponsored by the{ {Milk Marketing Board.}The race takes place every year. There were teams from Belgium, Czechoslovakia, Eire, England, Poland, Holland, Denmark, Germany, Switzerland, Russia, France and the USA, as well as a Raleigh team. It was a sprint finish between Belgium, the USA and Switzerland. The{ {Belgian}team{won,}the{USA}were{second.
